cscie55.hw3

Class Elevator

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie55.hw3.Elevator

  • public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Elevator class simulates an elevator for a multi-story building.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      String attribute that defines the elevator's availability.

    • Field Detail

      • CAPACITY

        public static int CAPACITY
        Defines the number of people that any Elevator can carry.

      • status

        private ElevatorStatus status
        String attribute that defines the elevator's availability.
        status E {EMPTY, AVAILABLE, FULL}
        See Also:
        ElevatorStatus

      • elevatorNumber

        private int elevatorNumber
        Number of the elevator in the building. This variable is used to identify which passengers are waiting for which elevator, so the load may be balanced among all elevators.

      • currentDirection

        private ElevatorDirection currentDirection
        Current direction on which the elevator is moving.
        currentDirection E {"UP", "DOWN"}

      • currentFloor

        private int currentFloor
        Current floor on which the elevator is standing.
        0 <= floor < NUMBER_OF_FLOORS

      • passengersOnboard

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Passenger> passengersOnboard
        Map that contains the passengers destined for each floor.
        The first parameter indicates the destined floor number. 0 <= floorNumber < Elevator.NUMBER_OF_FLOORS
        The second parameter contains the actual Passenger object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Elevator

        public Elevator(int elevatorNumber)
        Initializes each instance attribute to its corresponding value.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the elevator one floor up or down after determining the right direction to move.

      • determineDirection

        public void determineDirection()
        Rule 1: If it is moving upward and it is standing on the last floor (n = N - 1), changes direction to DOWN.
        Rule 2: If it is moving downward and it is standing on the first flor (n = 0), changes direction to UP.
        Rule 3: If it is moving upward but there aren't any more requests from upper floors and there aren't passengers inside, changes direction to DOWN.

      • getCurrentDirection

        public ElevatorDirection getCurrentDirection()
        Gets the current direction on which the elevator is moving.
        Returns:
        ElevatorDirection Current direction of the elevator.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns a String summarizing the pertinent values in the elevator.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String The message to be written on the standard output.

      • stopOnThisFloor

        public boolean stopOnThisFloor()
        Determines whether to stop on this floor by checking if there is a request on this floor in the same direction on which the elevator is moving or if the elevator is carrying passengers destined to current floor.
        Returns:
        boolean Whether the elevator should stop on this floor.

      • countPassengersToLoad

        public int countPassengersToLoad()
        Counts the number of passengers that should be loaded onto the elevator.
        Returns:
        int Number of passengers to load onto the elevator.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the specified elevator, unloads passengers destined to current floor and loads waiting passengers who are heading towards the same direction.

      • boardPassenger

        public void boardPassenger(int floor)
                    throws ElevatorFullException
        Boards one more passenger on current floor destined for the floor specified in its parameter.
        If capacity is FULL throws and exception indicating it and doesn't boards the passenger.
        Parameters:
        floor - The number of the floor to where the passenger is destined.
        Throws:
        ElevatorFullException - Exception to be thrown if it tries to load one more passenger into the Elevator but it is full.

      • getCurrentFloor

        public int getCurrentFloor()
        Gets the value of the currentFloor attribute
        Returns:
        The number of the current floor

      • setCurrentDirection

        public void setCurrentDirection(ElevatorDirection direction)
        Sets the current direction of the elevator to the value specified in its parameter.
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction to assign to the elevator.

      • countPassengersOnboard

        public int countPassengersOnboard()
        Returns the size of the passengersOnboard HashMap.
        Returns:
        int The number of passengers on board.

      • countPassengersDestined

        public int countPassengersDestined()
        Counts the number of passengers on board destined to the specified floor.
        Returns:
        int Number of passengers destined to the specified floor.

      • unloadPassengersDestined

        public java.util.List<Passenger> unloadPassengersDestined()
        Gets a list with the passengers destined to the specified floor and removes them from the passengersOnboard HashMap.
        Returns:
        A List with the passengers destined to the specified floor.

      • countRequestsFromUpperFloors

        private int countRequestsFromUpperFloors(int floor)
        Returns the number of people from upper floors who are heading upwards.
        Parameters:
        floor - Current floor number, 0 <= floor < NUMBER_OF_FLOORS.
        Returns:
        int Number of people from upper floors who are waiting for an elevator for UP service.

      • updateElevatorStatus

        private void updateElevatorStatus()
        Sets the elevator status to EMPTY, FULL or AVAILABLE according to the number of passengers on board.
